rightHalf.bio: My career journey started at Infosys in India, where I worked on front-end development for Apple, and continued at Charles Schwab before joining Deutsche Bank. I'm passionate about staying at the forefront of technology and enjoy the challenges it brings. Outside of work, I'm dedicated to table tennis, where I've turned my enthusiasm into skill through consistent practice and competition. Balancing my professional life with my love for the sport, I also make time to travel and stay fit.

experiences.summary: Analyzed business requirements and participated in review meetings. Designed and developed responsive cross-platform web pages for Safari, Chrome, Firefox, and IE using HTML5, CSS3, Sass, and ES6. Ensured code quality and modularity according to client standards. Created and organized test cases with the Jasmine framework. Utilized NodeJS and npm extensively in the build process.

Participated in Agile development, attending daily stand-ups and sprint ceremonies. Collaborated with the Product Owner to understand requirements, designed and proposed solutions, and implemented approved designs. Conducted code reviews, wrote unit and integration tests, and optimized code with QA feedback. Used Bitbucket for version control, verified builds on Bamboo, addressed Veracode scan issues, and deployed services on Harness. Managed PCF cloud instances post-deployment and supported offshore teams.

Developed an in-house tool for value adjustments, trade extraction, selection, and reference data enrichment for Deutsche Bank's counterparties, integrating it with a risk assessment tool. Successfully decommissioned the Gravity tool, saving the company 300K Euros.

projects.name: Checkout Redesign
projects.description: The project aimed to enhance Apple’s website UI by making it faster, easier to use, and feature-rich. We used CanJS for merchandise pages and CoherentJS for transaction pages. Later, we proposed redesigning key transaction pages—Checkout, Shipping, Payment, and Confirmation—using ReactJS, JSX, and ECMAScript 6.

projects.name: Flight Data Monitoring
projects.description: A web application that was created to gather student pilots data and perform analysis and grade the students. Incidents such as HardLanding and NearMiss incidents could be corrected and help students in a better way.

projects.name: Performance Reporting Platform
projects.description: The project involved developing a back-end application to evaluate portfolio performance against standard benchmarks. We transitioned legacy backend components to a pipeline-based architecture, utilizing .NET Core and MongoDB for the backend.

projects.name: Xva Manager
projects.description: In-house tool for trade extraction, selection, and reference data enrichment, used before sending data to the Risk Finder for assessment. It’s a legacy application with WCF technology, WPF front end, and Oracle Database.
